metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45083 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Cobbler before 3.3.1. Files in /etc/cobbler areworld readable. Two of those files contain some sensitive information thatcan be exposed to a local user who has non-privileged access to the server.The users.digest file contains the sha2-512 digest of users in a Cobblerlocal installation. In the case of an easy-to-guess password, it's trivialto obtain the plaintext string. The settings.yaml file contains secretssuch as the hashed default password.

criterions.comment: cobbler: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
